title: Chinese Embassy donates 30,000 masks and 121,000 posters to Sri Lankan Transport Board and Health Promotion Bureau
description: On August 17, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka donated 30,000 surgical masks and 21,000 COVID-19 prevention posters to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and 100,000 COVID-19 prevention posters to the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB). The posters were in the Sinhala and Tamil languages. The masks and posters were intended to be distributed to thousands of bus drivers and conductors and to be distributed in public places including bus stops, railway stations, markets, hospitals, schools, health institutions, government offices, and workplaces across Sri Lanka. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Hu Wei, the Chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka, handed over the medical masks to Kinsley Ranawaka, the Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB). The Chinese Envoy also handed over the COVID-19 prevention posters to Dr. Uthpala Amarasinghe, a representative of the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) of Sri Lanka, during the ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description

The posters were in the Sinhala and Tamil languages. The masks and posters were intended to be distributed to thousands of bus drivers and conductors and to be distributed in public places including bus stops, railway stations, markets, hospitals, schools, health institutions, government offices, and workplaces across Sri Lanka. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Hu Wei, the Chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka, handed over the medical masks to Kinsley Ranawaka, the Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB). The Chinese Envoy also handed over the COVID-19 prevention posters to Dr. Uthpala Amarasinghe, a representative of the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) of Sri Lanka, during the ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies and health education materials without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of surgical masks and COVID-19 prevention posters for public health purposes

title: Chinese Embassy donates 200 coveralls, 198 pairs of goggles, 10 thermometers, 10,000 masks, and 2,500 surgical gloves to the Sri Lanka Navy
description: On April 24, 2020, the Defense Attaché of the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka donated 200 coveralls, 198 pairs of goggles, 10 thermometers, 10,000 masks, and 2,500 surgical gloves to the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) to assist its COVID-19 pandemic response. This donation came amidst an outbreak of COVID-19 that infected dozens of SLN personnel at Welisara Base testing positive for COVID19.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

This donation came amidst an outbreak of COVID-19 that infected dozens of SLN personnel at Welisara Base testing positive for COVID19.

title: CHEC donates a PCR machine and test equipment to the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
description: On March 1, 2020, the Sri Lanka Division of China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd. (CHEC) donated Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) machine and test equipment to Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) to assist its COVID-19 pandemic response. This donation was made at the request of Chairman of SLPA General Daya Ratnayake.

title: China Merchants Foundation contributes to a donation of three wheelchairs worth $9,000 USD to wheelchair tennis players (Linked to Project ID#95355)
description: In late June 2020, China Merchants Foundation (CMF), a foundation established by the China Merchants Group (CMG) for philanthropic endeavors, and Colombo International Container Terminals (CICT) — a joint venture between China Merchants Port (CMPort) Holdings Company Limited and Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) — collaborated donate three custom-made, professional grade, titanium wheelchairs worth $9,000 USD (£7,200 GBP; €8,000 EUR) to three internationally-ranked Sri Lankan wheelchair tennis players, as part of CMF and CICT's support for the Wheelchair Tennis Programme of the Sri Lanka Tennis Association (SLTA). The three players were all veterans of Sri Lanka Army that became para-athletes after injuries sustained during the Sri Lankan Civil War.  CMF's contribution to the donation is captured in Project ID#95354. CICT's contribution to the donation is captured in Project ID#95355.
staff_comments: 1. The specific breakdown of CMF and CICT to this $9,000 USD donation is unknown. For now, AidData has assumed that each donor contributed approximately $4,500 USD to the donation.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title

# Description

The three players were all veterans of Sri Lanka Army that became para-athletes after injuries sustained during the Sri Lankan Civil War.  CMF's contribution to the donation is captured in Project ID#95354. CICT's contribution to the donation is captured in Project ID#95355.
justification: Project is a philanthropic donation of medical equipment to support disabled athletes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of wheelchairs to para-athletes, social development focus

title: China Merchants Port Group donates 1,000 protective suits to the Government of Sri Lanka
description: On March 25, 2020, China Merchants Port Group (CMPort) donated 1,000 protective suits to the Government of Sri Lanka to support its response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The suits were specifically intended for doctors and medical staff that were treating infected patients in key government hospitals.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese government donates 25,000 PCR test kits to Sri Lanka
